body:
in order to find out if your server setup is valid regarding webdav you can run the litmus webdav test suite:
http://www.webdav.org/neon/litmus/

i am having trouble to configure litmus with ssl support -_-
does litmus work for you?

> i am having trouble to configure litmus with ssl support -_-

what's the error?

> does litmus work for you?

yes ;-)

litmus is working, installing libneon27-gnutls-dev fixed problems with "./configure --with-ssl"

here is the output it produces:

    thomas@owncloud:~/litmus-0.13$ make url=https://owncloud.thomas-steinbrenner.net creds="test test" check
    make[1]: entering directory `/home/thomas/litmus-0.13/lib/neon'
    bundled neon build not being used.
    make[1]: leaving directory `/home/thomas/litmus-0.13/lib/neon'
    gcc  -o basic src/basic.o -l. -ltest -lneon-gnutls
    gcc  -o copymove src/copymove.o -l. -ltest -lneon-gnutls
    gcc  -o props src/props.o -l. -ltest -lneon-gnutls
    gcc  -o locks src/locks.o -l. -ltest -lneon-gnutls
    gcc  -o http src/http.o -l. -ltest -lneon-gnutls
    -> running `basic':
     0. init.................. pass
     1. begin................. fail (could not create new collection `/litmus/' for tests: 404 not found
    server must allow `mkcol /litmus/' for tests to proceed)
    <- summary for `basic': of 2 tests run: 1 passed, 1 failed. 50.0%
    see debug.log for network/debug traces.
    make: *** [check] error 1
    thomas@owncloud:~/litmus-0.13$

> see debug.log for network/debug traces.

can you post that file? thx

looks like webdav is setup correctly - time for the android guys to analyse this.
@ rjimenez can you have a look?

i’m closing this issue because it has been inactive for a few months. this probably means that the issue is not reproducible or it has been fixed in a newer version.

please reopen if the error still persists with the [latest stable version](http://owncloud.org/install/) (currently owncloud 5.0.9) and then please use the [issue template](https://raw.github.com/owncloud/core/master/issue_template.md). you an also contribute directly by providing a patch – see the [developer manual](http://doc.owncloud.org/server/5.0/developer_manual/). :)

thank you!
